ratings.comment: He came back to teach, and I'm glad he was the one lecturing: he is knowledgeable, experienced, and makes the content easy to understand (as if any of it is hard at all). Reading and reflections were not difficult, and the field trip was an easy way to get credit for one of the reflections. Tests are doable but a bit harder than you'd expect.

He really knows what he is talking about. The lectures are tedious and can be very boring, but every once in a while there is a lecture that will be interesting. You have to get a 92 in the class to get an A which sucks. This class is also some common sense, but also a lot of memorization. The exams are doable, but not easy. Requires studying.

He has so many relevant experiences in the field. The contents in the lectures are interesting, especially those involve in his personal experiences. Papers are fairly easy. The only thing is, he's pretty mono-toned, so lectures could be really boring.

Glad that he's back teaching. Knows what he is talking about, articulates well, and communicates the relatively easy  material well. Assignments are reading-based and field trips- not too big of a deal. Exams are not as easy as expected; get easier as the semester progresses, but the first one asked a lot of miniscule details

Dramatically changed from previous years. Lectures are deceivingly simple; you need to know a lot of the minutiae/concepts for exams, especially from the book. And when most questions come with "all/none of the above", you find yourself guessing more than you like. Not impossible, but you need to put the effort in to get an A, so study a lot!

as a guest lecturer in Christopher Vaughn's extinction, i really enjoy Stan's lectures (more so than Chris's). i can see how people find him boring if they're not interested in conservation; however if you are he is a great guy to talk to!

This was the most boring class ever.  actually, i felt like he was trying to convert me to his political agenda from day one, and i was surprised there was a class all about a political agenda.  i don't feel like i learned any actual info, just propaganda about conservation.  i really hated this class, but it was easy.

Interesting class if you are interested in conservation. Papers are pretty easy and grading isn't bad at all if you follow directions. Stan has an amazing background and really knows what he is talking about. Class isn't required but necessay to attend if you want to do well on the discussion quizes.

No reason to go to class except to turn in homework.  No incentive to pay attention or read.  Stan's a nice guy, but he should use his voice for recording tapes to cure insomnia rather than teaching this required course for CBSD grad students.
Good Class, I really like it!!
Great class, very informative, good weekly problem sets that generally made you think. Some decent computer modeling work. Nice overview for the field & Stan has incredible stories/experience
BORING. No tests just three papers and discussion quizzes. All notes are online. Basically no reason to go to lexture at all. The papers are easy but are graded harshly.

Great guy, lectures are very interesting.  Some of the homework and exams were harder than I had thought, but overall not too bad.  He often tells interesting stories of the work he has done, great to listen to if you're interested in wildlife stuff.
one of the best prof's I've ever had-his lectures are filled with neat stories and examples
The most boring class ever and awfully hard for not having any exams
